metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0432 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL Server 5.5.40 and earlier allows remote authenticated users to affect availability via vectors related to Server : InnoDB : DDL : Foreign Key.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0432` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient18 - 5.5.41-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libmysqld-pic - 5.5.41-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client - 5.5.41-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-5.5 - 5.5.41-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.41-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common - 5.5.41-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server - 5.5.41-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.5 - 5.5.41-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.41-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.5 - 5.5.41-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.5.41-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.5 - 5.5.41-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.41-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
